metadata.Title: CVE-2021-2010 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Client product of Oracle MySQL (component: C API). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.50 and prior, 5.7.32 and prior and 8.0.22 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Client. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access to some of MySQL Client accessible data and unauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) of MySQL Client. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.2 (Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:L).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2010` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-router - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it, marking it as ignored.

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.23-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
